fields.description: All my team members are getting error while checking out the code from stash using Source Tree or Git. We have tried to troubleshoot it but still it is not working.
fields.summary: Not able to check out code using Source Tree in Windows 10

fields.description:
Whenever I select "Remote" on a new tab, the first entry in my "Remote Repositories" list is selected and loading. Since that's almost always the wrong account, I usually select a different one. This does not automatically triggers loading the other user. It sometimes even does not highlight the Refresh button and always shows the search result from the first selection. I then have to select any other account, wait for the list to refresh and then select the desired one again.
Selecting any account should immediately cancel the current list request and trigger a new one on the new account.
fields.summary: Switching between Remote Repositories does not always refresh

fields.description:
SourceTree hangs when attempting to diff files across two or more commits.  Every time I have upgraded via the self-update feature, it breaks this feature. I always have to go back to trusty old 2.6.10.  It was first noticed on the 3.0+ releases.

Reproduce issue:
1) select two commits on the repo within the history 
2) select a file in the modified files window
3) observe only a spinning blue circle in the diff window

I use this internal diff feature often to quickly track down changes which introduce bugs in a code base. It is a great feature which works flawlessly in 2.6.10.

I'm always using the latest embedded git.
fields.summary: Diff window hangs when comparing across 2 commits.
Tabs show folder names instead of repository name

fields.description:
Developers many times set up new machines and copy over all their old data.  This includes a repos folder.  My repos folder has over 100 git repos in it.

If I want SourceTree to see all of them, I have to click 5 times per repo just to get a local repository to be recognized by sourcetree.

It would be great to allow a bulk import - just point sourcetree at a folder (e.g. c:/repos) and crawl the entire directory looking for repos under that directory to add.  At the end all repos are added.

As it stands now I have to click hundreds of times and it is very time consuming
fields.summary: Allow bulk import of local repos

fields.description: In our workflow we name our feature branches after our Jira ticket, ex. "feature/AAA-12345". This makes it very annoying to figure out what branch to switch to in sourcetree. I would like to be able to give each branch a descriptive name within sourcetree to make switching branches easier.
fields.summary: As a user of sourcetree I would like to be able to give my branches a local alias so switching branches becomes easier
Pull and Push counter doesn't update on refresh

fields.description: The display in the parent repository for changes in submodules does not work propper. Sometimes it dispalys the indicator but mostly the indicator is not shown.
fields.summary: Display of changes in Submodules does not work correctly

fields.description:
I would estimate that 50% of the time the Commit button ignores clicks in our environment. Based on my observations, clicks have no effect any time the green progress bar is churning in the upper left. The impact of this issue is that without constant conscious attention to whether or not the tool did the action requested, you can assume work is checked in and pushed when it is not.

  

Ideally the Commit button would be disabled during time periods when click events are ignored. 

 

*Expected*
 Clicking Commit should create a commit with the staged changes and active commit text

 
 *Actual*
 Click event is ignored, no commit created

 
!click-ignored.gif!
fields.summary: Commit button click is ignored and has no effect

fields.description:
When I maximize Sourcetree on external monitor - it crashes.
I'm using version 3.1.2

Steps to reproduce:
 * open SourceTree, it stays as normal window (not maximized) on laptop screen - works
 * maximize on laptop screen - works
 * make it again non-maximized on laptop screen - works
 * move it to external monitor as normal window - works
 * maximize on external monitor - it crashes (every time)

I attach log file. Crash starts a line 62.
I've noticed there are some log messages in Polish language.
fields.summary: Crash when maximizing on external monitor

fields.description:
h2. My need

I work on a very large project that uses more than 50 repositories.

It's not uncommon for us to have some large features that require making changes to 10+ repositories by the same developer. In such case, I find it easier to name the feature branch after the release that we are tracking in JIRA. In some other cases, I just a bug fix that requires changing several repos.

Sometimes, if many of these changes are - for instance - in PHP, I can attach the corresponding repos in a single workspace. But if the changes are spread across disparate technologies (PHP, the Java backend, the iOS and Android apps), then each one will be dealt with in a more suitable development environment.

The issues (human errors) start surfacing when it's time to merge everything and get ready for deployment. It's very easy to loose track of which repo has been changed. Especially if we have been working on a feature for weeks.

A temporary solution I have found was to write a small single line Bash script that scans my projects base folder and shows the name of the repositories that have a branch that matches a search key that I provided. For instance, I could search for "the-next-big-thing". That, of course, needed to be a checked out branch, but I have adjusted it to find the branch even if it's not checked out. The result is a nice list of things that need to be deployed in relation with the project or the release called "the-next-big-thing".
h2. The feature request

I was thinking that it might be possible to use the search feature in SourceTree's  "Local repositories" to find the same information. At the very least, it could be useful to find a using the repo's name, the current branch name, and the repo's path.

I can provide the script I have created if it can show you a proof of concept.

I have attached an screen capture of the screen I am referring to.

 

Thanks

 

!image-2019-04-24-14-50-47-831.png!
fields.summary: On the "Local repositories", allow the search to match branches and folder names as well

fields.description: When searching Jira for bugs, a lot of them are Open or InProgress but reading through the comments and you will see that it is now fixed. It would be helpful if Jira was kept up to date.

fields.description:
Пошаговая инструкция:
 1. Установить приложение на мобильное устройство (Android).
 2. Включить на устройстве "Автопереворот"
 3. Перейти в любой раздел меню; "Кабинет пользователя", "Мои билеты" "Купить билет", и перевернуть экран горизонтально. Отобразится белый экран с текстом "У вас нет актуальных билетов". 
 4. Выключить в этом положении режим "автопереворот", при этом приложение перестает реагировать на командную кнопку устройства "назад". При нажатии кнопки "выбор открытых приложений" или "домой" - приложение отключается и выдает сообщение об остановке работы.
 5. Снова попробовать войти в приложение, не включая " автоповорот" .

***Ожидаемый результат: Открытие (запуск) приложения.

***Фактический результат: Сообщение "Приложение Ж.Б. остановлено" и предлагает выбор действий:
 а) Закрыть программу
 б) Отправить отзыв
fields.summary: "Железнодорожные билеты". Приложение зависает при отключении функции  "автоповорот экрана", на мобильном устройстве,- когда оно переходит в режиме отображения "актуальных билетов пользователя". Действие "вернуться", или "домой", отключает приложение.

"Steps to reproduce"

Open the application “Железнодорожные билеты”

Choose a direction (Kiev-Vinnitsa)
 Select the date (May 01 2019)
 Click "Train Search"
 Choose train (Kiev Passenger - Przemysl 715K)
 Choose "Second Class"

Choose a seat in the railway carriage №4 (seat 13)
 On the footnote at the bottom of the screen, click Checkout

Enter Name and Surname
 Click "To Cart"
 Click "Select Return Ticket"
 Select the date (May 01 2019)
 Choose train Vorokhta –Kiev-Passenger 144L
 Choose Placement
 Choose a seat in the railway carriage №8 (seat 52)
 On the footnote at the bottom of the screen, click "Checkout"
 Enter Name and Surname
 Click "To Cart"
 Click" Pay"
 Click the button "I accept the agreement"
 Click "Continue"
 Expected result - the program will prohibit the operation further since the time of the return ticket is earlier than outbound
 Actual result - the system allows you to enter credit data and, consequently, pay for both tickets

fields.description:
I created a test branch to demonstrate this issue, https://bitbucket.org/wakefly_cbass/test/commits/all  

I created an initial commit, 13b2c38 , and a second commit. 0b1f714, directly on master.
At this point, I switched back to 13b2c38 and created two branches off of it, Branch1 and Branch2.

I proceeded to do a third commit onto Branch1 (CreateBranch1.png), and a fourth onto Branch2 (CreateBranch2.png).
I then did a merge of Branch1, and then Branch2, into master.

In Bitbucket, this shows up cleanly - I've only committed one file to each branch, and when they merge only one branch is shown.

But in SourceTree, each merge shows an extraneous file not shown in BitBucket - Merging Branch 1 shows the second commit (0b1f714) as part of the merge, and Merging Branch 2 shows the file from Branch 1 as part of the merge. (MergeBranch1.png, MergeBranch2.png)

As a followup, after this, any merges involving these branches, will forever also show that file as part of the merge. (Branch2MergeAgain.png)

The issue persists, even if the repo is deleted entirely from SourceTree, and pulled again from Bitbucket,
fields.summary: Sourcetree showing wrong Merge information
Cannot clone repository from sourcetree

fields.description:
SourceTree's history view has a log view in the top half and a commit view and a file view in the bottom half. The vertical dividing line between the commit details view and the file details view can be easily moved by clicking and dragging. However, the horizontal dividing line between the log view on the upper half and the two views on the bottom half cannot be moved in some situations.

When the SourceTree window is maximized and a file is selected in the commit view (and therefore shows up in the file view), you can try to click and drag the central horizontal dividing line but it won't move. It seems to be impossible in most cases to deselect a file, but it can be done if "Uncommitted changes" is the selected commit and you stage or unstage a file. Once the file is deselected you can resize the bottom panel. Then once you select another commit and a file automatically becomes selected then some more strange behavior can be observed.

After the central horizontal dividing line has been moved with no files selected, then you can move it when a file is selected but it only moves down to a certain limit. It moves as though there's a limit to how small the bottom panel can get. If you drag past that limit then the panel snaps back to the size it was before you started resizing.

Repro steps:
 # Open a repo with many commits and at least one uncommitted change in SourceTree
 # In the log view in the upper half, select a commit
 # Try to move the central horizontal dividing line between the upper half and the lower half
 # Observe faulty behavior #1 (the line will not move)
 # In the log view in the upper half, select "Uncommitted changes"
 # If a file is selected, stage or unstage it to deselect it
 # Click and drag the central horizontal dividing line between the upper half and the lower half upwards so that the bottom panel becomes large
 # Select a commit
 # Try to move the central horizontal dividing line between the upper half and the lower half downwards so that the bottom panel becomes small
 # Observe faulty behavior #2 (the line will snap back into place when you drag down too far)
fields.summary: The bottom panel in the history view has problems getting resized

fields.description:
I have a 3440 x 1440 Pixel monitor and when I e.g. press the push button I need to move my mouse over half the monitor to click again. Then I need to move my mouse to other end of the monitor to close an error message then all the way back to push and ...
you get the idea?
It feels a bit too much mouse moving for these tasks.
I would suggest to open the dialogs closer to the button that opens them and avoid very large full screen width dialogs.
thx
fields.summary: shorten mouse ways

2 - в поле "Виберіть культуру" выбрать "Ріпак"
3 - в поле "Виберіть базис поставки" выбрать "Перевантажувальний термінал для перевалки зернових та олійних культур (м. Миколаїв)"
3 - заполнить поле "Виберіть показник вологості, %:" значением "9", а поле "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:" любым из допустимых значений (2-100)
4 - нажать "розрахувати"

Ожидаемый результат: по формуле Дюваля (x=(fact -baz) / (100 - baz)*100), где fact - введенное нами значение; baz-базисное значение, указанное на сайте, у нас должен выйти результат x=1.09% Фактический результат: система проводит некорректные вычисления и в рез-те x=1%
fields.summary: калькулятор: некорректное вычисление при вводе "показника вологості"= 9, для "культури" - ріпак, в "базисі поставки" - Перевантажувальний термінал для перевалки зернових та олійних культур (м. Миколаїв)
калькулятор: некорректное вычисление процентной части скидки по влажности при вводе корректных данных

fields.description:
1 - открыть http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html
2 - в поле "Виберіть культуру" выбрать "Кукурудза"
3 - в поле "Виберіть базис поставки" выбрать "Перевантажувальний термінал для перевалки зернових та олійних культур (м. Миколаїв)"
3 - заполнить поле "Виберіть показник вологості, %:" значением "15", а поле "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:" любым из допустимых значений (2-100)
4 - нажать "розрахувати"

Ожидаемый результат: по формуле Дюваля (x=(fact -baz) / (100 - baz)*100), где fact - введенное нами значение; baz-базисное значение, указанное на сайте, у нас должен выйти результат x=1.16%
Фактический результат: система проводит некорректные вычисления и в рез-те x=1%
fields.summary: калькулятор: некорректное вычисление процентной части скидки по влажности при вводе корректных данных

fields.description:

fields.description:
*Шаги воспроизведения: 
#Открыть: http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html
# 1. Ввести: Буквенные значения в поля для введения числовых символов.
# 2. Ввести: числовые значения превышающие пороговые (0-100). Например значение 150 в поле "показник вологості, %", и значение 300 в поле "показник сміттєвої домішки, %"

* 1. Ожидаемый результат: показ сообщения об ошибке: "Разрешается вводить только числовые значения".
* 2. Ожидаемый результат: показ сообщения об ошибке: "Вы ввели недопустимые числовые значения. Введите значение от 0 до 100".
* 1. Фактический результат: В расчетах нулевые значения.
* 2. Фактический результат: Абсолютно неверные, расчетные показатели: Знижка по вологості - 158,14%, -9473,76 грн., Знижка по засміченості - 298,00%, 3754,80 грн.
fields.summary: Калькулятор: 1. Нет сообщения об ошибке при вводе буквенных символов вместо цифр. 2. Калькулятор: нет ограничения для ввода цифрового значения % (от 0 до 100), позволяет вносить значения превышающие лимит, при этом выполняет неверные расчеты.

fields.description:
Sourcetree randomly hangs. Oddly it seems to work OK when not maximised (although it has occasionally hung in windowed mode too). However, when maximised it seems to hang almost immediately. 

I have tried version 3.0.17 and this does _not_ hang however the same exception as below is recorded in the log.

Everytime a hang occurs an exception is recorded in the sourcetree.log. 

ERROR [2019-04-16 11:59:11,673] [6] [SourceTree.Analytics.NPS.Service.NPSFeedbackService] [Log] - NPS: Couldn't record shown prompt
System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: An error occurred while sending the request. ---> System.Net.WebException: The remote name could not be resolved: 'sourcetree-nps-bridge.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net'

--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---

fields.description: I am running Sourcetree on a Windows 10 Pro workstation.  I leave it running and remote-connect to my workstation from a laptop over Remote Desktop Connection.  As soon as I log into my workstation, I see a bug report that Sourcetree has crashed.  It happens every time, and I need to restart Sourcetree.  I don't recall this happening with older versions.

fields.description:
In my company, we must access Web sites on the Internet via authentication proxy server which adopts BASIC authentication.
When calling "git clone" via HTTPS from GitHub, we experience no problem and proxy authentication works normally, however, in case if we click on "Check For Updates", we encounter below error messages saying proxy authentication is required. As a result, we are unable to update our Source Tree.


ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:20,371] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Couldn't read staging user ID
ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:20,376] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Couldn't read staging user ID
ERROR [2019-04-10 11:21:24,662] [1] [Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper] [Log] - Unable to check for Updates.
System.Net.WebException: The remote server returned an error: (407) Proxy authentication required
 at System.Net.HttpWebRequest.EndGetResponse(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
 at System.Net.WebClient.GetWebResponse(WebRequest request, IAsyncResult result)
 at System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsResponseCallback(IAsyncResult result)
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
 at Squirrel.Utility.<LogIfThrows>d__43`1.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
 at Squirrel.FileDownloader.<DownloadUrl>d__3.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
 at Squirrel.UpdateManager.CheckForUpdateImpl.<CheckForUpdate>d__2.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
 at Squirrel.UpdateManager.<CheckForUpdate>d__7.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
 at Sourcetree.Installer.Squirrel.Utils.UpdateHelper.<CheckForUpdate>d__16.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()

fields.description:
When there is a long commit message, the message UI element expands to the point that you cannot see any other UI elements on the File Status tab until you delete part of the commit message.  This is particularly problematic when performing a merge with many conflicts as pictured below.  You cannot resolve the conflicts until you delete enough of the message that the file list appears.  This message continually regenerates, taking over the tab whenever Sourcetree refreshes, making it a continuous problem until a commit is performed.

!commitMessageTooLong.jpg!
fields.summary: "File Status" tab UI components inaccessible with long commit message

fields.description:
When I am trying to close one feature or one Release with a "/" in its name the ComboBox in the dialog is cleared after a few seconds, so I can't do the action (for example. "Finish feature"). The workaround is push the "OK" button quickly.

!image-2019-04-12-11-52-34-702.png!

!image-2019-04-12-11-53-30-128.png!

This issue happens to me always with the releases, because we tag them with the component and the version (for example "MiComponente/1.0.0.0")
fields.summary: Issuies with branches with "/" in GitFlow
One-click file discard on unstaged files list
Hunk Navigation and Total Number of Hunks

fields.description:
As recently implemented on Mac, the ability to see the a list of historical commands issued on a repository with their full output. 

Output should persist only for the life of the app and should top out at a user-configurable number.
fields.summary: Command log

fields.description:
Tab with action menu bar take up too much window space, see image attached, and we are not always committing, pulling, pushing or fetching when reviewing merge conflicts, so bar does not need to be visible present at all times.

Please allow to expand/collapse (ribbon style) the action menu bar underneath the tab to regain the window space.

Bar should be collapsed when app loads, MS Office style.
fields.summary: Collapsible Action Menu (Ribbon Style)

fields.description:
We are using GIT version from Microsoft to work with a huge GIT repository, available here : [https://github.com/Microsoft/VFSForGit]

Until version 2.19.0.gvfs.1.34.gc7fb556, SourceTree can recognize GIT system install.

After this version, SourceTree can not find GIT install.

We have checked that files are correctly present on the disk, and everything is working fine from the command line. The PATH environment variable correctly contains the expected path to GIT install folder (in our case it is C:\Program Files\Git\cmd).

The behavior was the same with previous versions of SourceTree (but can not remember at which version the problem occured).
fields.summary: Git system install not recognized by SourceTree

fields.description: While typing on commit box the flashing cursor is not visible. User has no idea where is he typing. No way to edit other than removing message from back.
fields.summary: No cursor on Commit box.

fields.description: The Windows installer for SourceTree is found to contain a Trojan Trojan.Reconyc.Win32.21421 by Zillya antivirus
fields.summary: SourceTree Installer marked as containing a virus

fields.description:
When adding a large file to the index Sourcetree warns that the file is not tracked by GIT LFS and suggest to add it to LFS tracking first, even though the file is already tracked by a tracking rule using a simple RegExp.

Example: foo.gz file, tracking rule *.[Gg][Zz] to handle (especially on Windows) different ways of upper/lower case for the filename extension.
fields.summary: LFS warning regarding file not under LFS control even though it is

fields.description:
**When I try to open Sourcetree the blue splash screen appears and then there is a progress bar which quickly reaches 100%. Then it disappears and I cannot see the program in the taskbar or task manager.

 

*Log:*

The system cannot find the file specified.

fields.description: Would it be possible to let user to chose where does user want to have a workspace?  After updated source tree to 3.1.2 version File status, History and Search is under worspace (left side) .. I would like to have it where it was (down with files)
fields.summary: Workspace options

fields.description: In the pull pop-up, train the "Remote branch to pull" selection when changing the "pull from remote" section if the selected branch exists in the new remote.

fields.description:
I have a repository where the code is written in "Windows-1252" format. In order to see the changes of the code correctly, I have to choose "Windows-1252" in the Sourcetree config. But when I do it, the git log entries appear mangled. If i choose UTF-8, I see the log entries OK, but the code is mangled.

Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Log text doesn't appear well when charset selected is Windows-1252

fields.description: Sourcetree don't show the number of commit to push on the push button (Invia in italian)
fields.summary: Sourcetree don't show the number of commit to push

fields.description: Occasionally when I open Sourcetree my workspace is lost and I can't see any of the repositories I had open.  Normally opening Sourcetree shows all of the repos I've been working in and added to the workspace.  But now, frequently when I open Sourcetree I see an empty app.  Help!
fields.summary: Workspace corrupted and repo views lost

fields.description: When launching SourceTree 3.1.2 the application is freezing when trying to show the DIFF on my WPF XAML file. I've tried completely uninstalling ST including all AppData/Local/ST folders and the problem remains. I'm unable to view or use ST with this one repo that has WPF and the latest commit that has XAML changes. It was fine prior.
fields.summary: SourceTree for Windows 3.1.2 freezes when trying to diff a XAML file

fields.description:
Hi!

I am trying to get my current solution folder to revert to exactly the state it was in some months ago. The commit I want to go back to is tagged but is not a branch.

If I double-click the tagged commit I want to go back to, SourceTree tells me I am creating a detached HEAD but says I can subsequently create a branch so I don't lose the changes I will make.  I go ahead with this and select the 'Clean' checkbox to discard all changes.

When I then go to look at my solution folder in Windows Explorer, it is a hotchpotch of the old and the new.  I do get back the folders that were in existence when I created the tagged version a few months ago but I also still have new folders that I have created since and did not exist back then.  This gives me zero confidence that I can go ahead doing a patch for the old software.

I would be surprised to discover something as big as this is a bug but I have read your help on SourceTree and an obviously missing something.  I thought that double-clicking a commit would _*completely*_ change the solution back to how it was at that point in time?  If double-clicking is doing what it is supposed to, I'd suggest two things:
 # Make it more obvious in the help files what double-clicking a commit means because I obviously completely misunderstand it.
 # Perhaps add a right-click option to do what I am trying to do.  ( I am guessing command-line Git can do what I want but the SourceTree UI is not accessing this?)

I realise this is probably not a bug but any help would be most welcome.

 

Kind wishes ~ Patrick
fields.summary: Double-clicking a previous commit should revert solution to exactly that state.

fields.description:
Cannot launch sourcetree application after installation. maybe something wrong with my environment, I hava try to change older version of sourcetree, but none of them work,

I found the log file and see error like this :

 
{code:java}
//sourcetree.log

ERROR [2019-04-02 12:40:30,900] [1] [Sourcetree.Composition.VSMef.Net471.CompositionExceptionHelper] [Log] - PartDiscoveryException:
Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.PartDiscoveryException: Unable to load assembly "C:\Users\yindongchao\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.1.2\SourceTree.exe" for scanning. ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: 未能加载文件或程序集“Sourcetree, Version=3.1.2.3027, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null”或它的某一个依赖项。找到的程序集清单定义与程序集引用不匹配。 (异常来自 HRESULT:0x80131040)
   在 System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly._nLoad(AssemblyName fileName, String codeBase, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly locationHint, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks)
   在 System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoadAssemblyName(AssemblyName assemblyRef, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly reqAssembly, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks)
   在 System.Reflection.Assembly.Load(AssemblyName assemblyRef)
   在 Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.PartDiscovery.<>c__DisplayClass11_0.<CreatePartsAsync>b__0(String path)
   --- 内部异常堆栈跟踪的结尾 ---
{code}
The whole log file attached below.

help plz.
fields.summary: Cannot launch sourcetree after installation

fields.description: SourceTree displays "Nothing to commit" eventhough there are a lot of changed files in the current working directory. Executing "Refresh" does not change the situation . The workspace status also displays "17" changes next to "File Status".
fields.summary: Changed files not displayed

fields.description: For some reason it is not possible to open a repository from the favorites list (both in the sidebar and the new tab way). Sourcetree just ignores any commands and if you double click on the repository it moves it out of the folder into the root.
fields.summary: Cannot open repositories from favorites list

fields.description:
When trying to drag a repository to another folder or to another place in the current folder (e.g. when trying to move a repository from the bottom of the list to the top) the reorder fails.

1) You cannot drag beyond what is currently displayed on the top of the screen. In the previous version sourcetree used to scroll the list so you could drag to the top, now it just does nothing, or suggests that you want to drop it in the top level (i.e. at the bottom of the list)

2) If the drag fails sourcetree puts the repository at the bottom in the global folder

 

So now the only way to have repositories in a sensible order is to change the backend XM
fields.summary: Cannot reorder repositories in the Local Repositories list

fields.description:
I just upgraded from 2.7.x and now 3.1.2 is entirely unusable for me.

I used to have about 8-10 tabs open with some very large repos, some only accessible via VPN. I thought the issue might be related to those but even after removing them, it does not help.

I have about 4-6 tabs open, each fairly small in history, the largest has less than 1000 commits.

If a tab is selected that has local changes that are uncommitted, the diff view works fine. I can also push, etc. But if I switch to a tab that has no uncommited changes and attempt to view the git history, the history shows up for the current branch but it fails to show the diff in the bottom right for the currently selected commit file. The issue also happens if I have uncommited files and I select a commit in the history. It seems that attempting to show a git history diff hangs sourcetree. As far as I can tell, no git process is active in the background, the main UI thread uses 100% CPU usage and the callstack is deep into UI related code.

I let it run for 20-30mins and it never appears to recover. This happens even in repos with <100 commits.

 

I just tried 3.0.15 and it does not appear to suffer from this issue.
fields.summary: Hang when viewing a commit diff
The Open button on the new Local repositories view context menu does not seem to work.
Git LFS patterns with [[:space:]] are not parsed correctly

fields.description:
SourceTree hangs very often. No obvious reproduction steps; it is hanging whenever I click on a commit.

I've looked at the stack in a debugger and it is this issue:

[https://github.com/RickStrahl/MarkdownMonster/issues/485]

More info here: [https://weblog.west-wind.com/posts/2019/Feb/14/WPF-Hanging-in-Infinite-Rendering-Loop]
fields.summary: SourceTree deadlocks constantly due to .net 4.7.1 bug

fields.description: When connecting to my machine using Remote Desktop, Sourcetree will without fail crash. Opening Sourcetree, closing RDP and then attempting to use the normal desktop session again causes it to crash.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when using RDP

fields.description:
1.Відкрити Googl Play   на телефоні 
2.Завантажити  додаток " Железнодорожные билеты" ( або через будь який оглядач интернету "https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.uz.bookinguz&hl=ru")
3. Відкрити Додаток орієнтація Книжна 
4. Відкрити мені багатозадачності пристрою 
5. Відкрити будь який додаток  що підтримую альбомну орієнтацію 
6.Перейти в альбомну орієнтацію сторінки 
7.  через мені багатозадачності повернутися в додаток  " Железнодорожные билеты" не змінюючи орієнтацію сторінки 
8. Додаток завершив свою роботу
Очікуваний результат ( коректна робота додатку ) 
Screenshot_20190327-163353.png
Отриманий Результат ( Додаток вимикається) 
Screenshot_20190327-164257.png
fields.summary: програми завершує роботу

fields.description:
Can you please stop fixing functionalities that are not broken or at least give us the option to keep it the way it is.

What I mean by this is the changes in the UI, when using a UI for years it is disruptive when it changes. please give us at least the option to keep it the way it was.
fields.summary: Stop fixing not broken functionalities

fields.description:
Hi, 

Looking at a commit of a text file (.sql) it showed "No changes to show" on the specified file, I had to google the issue and found out that I had to increase the diff max size because my file was 1025Kb (max was 1024). Is it possible to modify the label "No changes to show" an make it "No changes to show, file exceedes diff max text size" or something likt this, thanks!
fields.summary: Text file that exceede the diff limit don't have a message to warn the user

fields.description: When you search in history (Search button on the left hand side) and a few matching commits are found, it is not possible to select multiple commits to view a combined diff of those commits, you can only view diffs for each individual commit in the list. But it is possible to multi-select commits in the normal history view.
fields.summary: Can't view combined diff for multiple commits in search
